```lean4
import Mathlib

/--
Let $v_1, \ldots, v_{12}$ be unit vectors in $\mathbb{R}^3$ from the origin to the vertices of a regular icosahedron. Show that for every vector $v \in \mathbb{R}^3$ and every $\epsilon > 0$, there exist integers $a_1, \ldots, a_{12}$ such that $\|a_1v_1 + \cdots + a_{12}v_{12} - v\| < ε$.
-/
theorem putnam_2023_a4
    (v : Fin 12 → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3))
    (hv :
      letI φ : ℝ := (1 + √5) / 2
      letI e : (Fin 3 → ℝ) ≃ EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3) := (WithLp.equiv _ _).symm
      letI s := √(1 + φ ^ 2)
      ∃ g : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3) ≃ₗᵢ[ℝ] EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3),
      g ∘ v = s⁻¹ • e ∘ ![![1, φ, 0], ![-1,  φ,  0], ![ 1, -φ,  0], ![-1, -φ,  0],
                          ![φ, 0, 1], ![ φ,  0, -1], ![-φ,  0,  1], ![-φ,  0, -1],
                          ![0, 1, φ], ![ 0, -1,  φ], ![ 0,  1, -φ], ![ 0, -1, -φ]])
    (w : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3))
    (ε : ℝ) (hε : ε > 0) :
    ∃ a : Fin 12 → ℤ, ‖∑ i, a i • v i - w‖ < ε :=
  sorry

    (v : Fin 12 → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3))
    (hv :
      letI φ : ℝ := (1 + √5) / 2

      letI s := √(1 + φ ^ 2)

                          ![φ, 0, 1], ![ φ,  0, -1], ![-φ,  0,  1], ![-φ,  0, -1],
                          ![0, 1, φ], ![ 0, -1,  φ], ![ 0,  1, -φ], ![ 0, -1, -φ]])

  have h₅ := congr_fun hg 4
  have h₆ := congr_fun hg 5
  have h₇ := congr_fun hg 6

  have h₁₁ := congr_fun hg 10
  have h₁₂ := congr_fun hg 11

    (v : Fin 12 → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3))
    (hv :
      letI φ : ℝ := (1 + √5) / 2
      letI e : (Fin 3 → ℝ) ≃ EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3) := (WithLp.equiv _ _).symm
      letI s := √(1 + φ ^ 2)
      ∃ g : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3) ≃ₗᵢ[ℝ] EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3),
      g ∘ v = s⁻¹ • e ∘ ![![1, φ, 0], ![-1,  φ,  0], ![ 1, -φ,  0], ![-1, -φ,  0],
                          ![φ, 0, 1], ![ φ,  0, -1], ![-φ,  0,  1], ![-φ,  0, -1],
                          ![0, 1, φ], ![ 0, -1,  φ], ![ 0,  1, -φ], ![ 0, -1, -φ]])
    (w : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 3))
    (ε : ℝ) (hε : ε > 0) :
    ∃ a : Fin 12 → ℤ, ‖∑ i, a i • v i - w‖ < ε := by

  have h₁ := congr_arg (fun f => f 0) hg
  have h₂ := congr_arg (fun f => f 1) hg
  have h₃ := congr_arg (fun f => f 2) hg
  have h₄ := congr_arg (fun f => f 3) hg
  have h₅ := congr_arg (fun f => f 4) hg
  have h₆ := congr_arg (fun f => f 5) hg
  have h₇ := congr_arg (fun f => f 6) hg

  have h₁₁ := congr_arg (fun f => f 10) hg
  have h₁₂ := congr_arg (fun f => f 11) hg
  clear hg
  simp at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇ h₈ h₉ h₁₀ h₁₁ h₁₂

  aesop
